result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.address: Kenosha County Jail, 1000 55th Street, Kenosha, WI 53140

records.addlTxt: Hearing on December 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:58 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe.  Defendant Deandre L Rodgers not in court.  Attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse in court for Deandre L Rodgers. 
Atty Sonderhouse requests his clients appearance be waived for today.
Kenosha had called the court and stated the defendant did not want to participate in today's hearing. 
Atty Sonderhouse updates the court with the status of defendant. 
Court sets a new hearing date.
Hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Detainer placed at: Kenosha County Jail

8:58 AM Defendant Deandre L Rodgers not in court.  Attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse in court for Deandre L Rodgers. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. 
Kenosha County Jail did zoom into court and stated the defendant did not want to participate today in court 
Atty Sonderhouse updates the court with the status of the matter and does request more time to work with other counsel.
State does not object to a new date.
Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Deandre L Rodgers
Current: Kenosha County Jail, 1000 55th Street, Kenosha, WI 53140 United States  (Effective: 08-31-2022)
Prior: c/o Waukesha County Jail 515 W Moreland Blvd, Waukesha, WI 53188

addressed to: Deandre L. Rodgers for hearing on 9-26-22

**Defendant not in custody at Waukesha County Jail Clerk forwards mail to Kenosha County Jail"

9:10 AM  Defendant Deandre L Rodgers appeared by video, in custody from Kenosha County Jail.  Attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse in court for Deandre L Rodgers.  Attorney Mary Caitlin Brejcha in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Sonderhouse states the Federal counsel has requested a evaluation of the defendant and requests this matter wait and be shared with this court. 
Atty Brejcha does agree with the suggestion and would request we have same examiner evaluate defendant as the federal court. 
Defendant makes a statement to the court.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Review hearing on August 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:13 AM Defendant Deandre L Rodgers in court, in custody, with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court will order defendant to do examination.   
Court will order defedant be transferred to complete the evaluation as in patient. 
Defendant is taken from the courtroom as he continues to talk over the Judge and not cooperate.  Review hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
dated 08-03-2022, filed by Dr. Jenna Goebel regarding defendant declining to participate in the competency evaluation.
signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on July 18, 2022
Order for Testing pursuant to 968.38(2m) Wis. Stats. signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on July 18, 2022
Order for Testing pursuant to 968.38(2m) Wis. Stats. filed by the State
Review hearing on August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:02 AM Defendant Deandre L Rodgers in court, in custody, with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
Court attempted to commence the hearing and defendant would not stop yelling after attempts for the court to have him be quiet.  
Defendant was taken out of the courtroom as he would not stop talking over the court and yelling.  
Court makes a record of what has happened and defendant is removed from courtroom. 
Atty Sonderhouse has attempted to meet with the defendant in the jail and he has not wanted to see Atty Sonderhouse. 
Defendant has forfeited his right to be in the courtroom for the hearing. 
State requests court grant the motion filed in  this matter and states reasons on the record. 
Defense takes no position. 
Court grants motion and State to file order.
Court will order a competency evaluation under 971.14(2). 
Time limits tolled on this matter. 
 Review hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Atty. Ronald Sonderhouse

02:21 PM Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez for attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse in court.   Defendant Deandre L Rodgers did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes there is not an order appointing counsel for Attorney Sonderhouse at this time.  The Court was notified the defendant has refused to come to Court though a writ was completed to allow the defendant to come to Court today.  Court notes there is a date set before the Judge on July 18, 2022 at 9:30 am and that will remain as previously set.  Bail remains as fixed.
Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on July 14, 2022
Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on July 13, 2022
Hearing on July 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:35 PM Defendant Deandre L Rodgers not in court.   District Attorney's Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant refused to come to court today from the jail.  Court will authorize the use of force to appear for the next hearing.  Atty. Hirt requests the court hold an initial hearing and motions the court for defendant to supply a blood sample.  Court proceeds with the initial appearance.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A (except in their official capacity) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

01:35 PM Defendant Deandre L Rodgers not in court.   District Attorney's Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant refused to come to court today from the jail.  Court will authorize the use of force to appear for the next hearing.  Atty. Hirt requests the court hold an initial hearing and motions the court for defendant to supply a blood sample.  Court proceeds with the initial appearance.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
